message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.IR. 

The paper focuses on evaluating the usefulness of image super-resolution (ISR) for other vision tasks, such as edge detection, semantic image segmentation, digit recognition, and scene recognition. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper uses machine learning techniques to evaluate the performance of ISR methods, which suggests that it could also belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the correlation between perceptual evaluation criteria and the usefulness of ISR, which could place it in the multimedia (cs.MM) and information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-categories.
